title: Mass Abjuration
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| [![Mass abjuration.png](/images/c/cb/Mass_abjuration.png)](/File:Mass_abjuration.png) Mass Abjuration |                                                      |
| :---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| Level                                                                                                 | 6                                                    |
| School1                                                                                               | [Summoning](/Summonings "Summonings")                |
| Source(s)                                                                                             | - [Grand Grimoire](/Grand_Grimoire "Grand Grimoire") |
| [Casting noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                           | 5                                                    |
| [Spell noise](/Spell_noise "Spell noise")                                                             | 0                                                    |

|   |                                                                                                                                                             |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | This spell attempts to send all hostile summoned creatures in sight to the place whence they came, or at least shorten their stay in the caster's locality. |

**Mass Abjuration** is a level 6 [Summoning](/Summoning "Summoning") spell which attempts to dispel all hostile summoned creatures in your [line of sight](/Line_of_sight "Line of sight"). Affected monsters have their remaining duration in this world drastically reduced; if this reduces the duration to zero or less, the monster is unsummoned entirely. Casting it at higher [spell power](/Spell_power "Spell power") reduces enemy duration to a greater extent. Be aware that summoned enemies visible through transparent [walls](/Wall "Wall") are unaffected by this spell.

A weaker version of this spell, [Abjuration](/Abjuration "Abjuration"), is a level 3 Summonings spell that affects a single targeted creature.

## Monster Version

Strictly speaking, there is no distinct monster-version of the Mass Abjuration spell. Instead, all high-level monster-version Summonings spells have an *inherent* 33% chance of a Mass Abjuration effect that *replaces* the effect of the previously intended spell. (This replacement only occurs if there are valid summons, hostile to the monster, in its [LOS](/LOS "LOS").) The high-level Summonings spells which have this inherent Mass Abjuration are:

- [Summon Demon](/Summon_Demon "Summon Demon")
- [Summon Greater Demon](/Summon_Greater_Demon "Summon Greater Demon")
- [Summon Drakes](/Summon_Drakes "Summon Drakes")
- [Summon Water Elemental](/Summon_Elemental "Summon Elemental")
- [Summon Iron Elemental](/Summon_Iron_Elemental "Summon Iron Elemental")
- [Shadow Creatures](/Shadow_Creatures "Shadow Creatures")
- [Summon Ugly Thing](/Summon_Ugly_Thing "Summon Ugly Thing")
- [Summon Scorpions](/Summon_Scorpions "Summon Scorpions")
- [Summon Mushrooms](/Summon_Mushrooms "Summon Mushrooms")
- [Summon Caniforms](/Summon_Caniforms "Summon Caniforms")
- [Summon Eyeballs](/Summon_Eyes "Summon Eyes")
- [Summon Dragon](/Summon_Dragon "Summon Dragon")
- [Summon Hydra](/Summon_Hydra "Summon Hydra")
- [Fire Summon](/Fire_Summon "Fire Summon")

## History

Player Mass Abjuration was removed in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), with [Aura of Abjuration](/Aura_of_Abjuration "Aura of Abjuration") taking its place.

Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), monsters had a 50% chance of casting Mass Abjuration instead of summoning.

Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), only the level 3 Abjuration spell existed, and it had the effect of the current Mass Abjuration spell.
html:
Mass Abjuration

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
 Mass Abjuration
Level 6
School1 Summoning
Source(s)
  • Grand Grimoire
Casting noise 5
Spell noise 0
This spell attempts to send all hostile summoned creatures in sight to the place whence they came, or at least shorten their stay in the caster's locality.

Mass Abjuration is a level 6 Summoning spell which attempts to dispel all hostile summoned creatures in your line of sight. Affected monsters have their remaining duration in this world drastically reduced; if this reduces the duration to zero or less, the monster is unsummoned entirely. Casting it at higher spell power reduces enemy duration to a greater extent. Be aware that summoned enemies visible through transparent walls are unaffected by this spell.

A weaker version of this spell, Abjuration, is a level 3 Summonings spell that affects a single targeted creature.

Monster Version

Strictly speaking, there is no distinct monster-version of the Mass Abjuration spell. Instead, all high-level monster-version Summonings spells have an inherent 33% chance of a Mass Abjuration effect that replaces the effect of the previously intended spell. (This replacement only occurs if there are valid summons, hostile to the monster, in its LOS.) The high-level Summonings spells which have this inherent Mass Abjuration are:

  • Summon Demon
  • Summon Greater Demon
  • Summon Drakes
  • Summon Water Elemental
  • Summon Iron Elemental
  • Shadow Creatures
  • Summon Ugly Thing
  • Summon Scorpions
  • Summon Mushrooms
  • Summon Caniforms
  • Summon Eyeballs
  • Summon Dragon
  • Summon Hydra
  • Fire Summon

History

Player Mass Abjuration was removed in 0.14, with Aura of Abjuration taking its place.

Prior to 0.14, monsters had a 50% chance of casting Mass Abjuration instead of summoning.

Prior to 0.10, only the level 3 Abjuration spell existed, and it had the effect of the current Mass Abjuration spell.

Retrieved from "http://crawl.chaosforge.org/index.php?title=Mass_Abjuration&oldid=45657"
